title: Great-grandmother beats coronavirus after five months in hospital and rehab
description: Marie Delus had not touched her mother since she took her to a New York City emergency room in March.

title: Hundreds of protesters march with Jacob Blake's family demanding justice
description: Jacob Blake's family led a march of hundreds of people on Saturday in Kenosha, Wisconsin, demanding an end to police violence and systemic racism.

title: US intel chief tells Congress it will get no more briefings on election security
description: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence has informed the House and Senate Select Committees on Intelligence that it'll no longer be briefing on election security issues, a senior administration official told CNN. It'll provide written updates, the official said.

title: The world's most expensive sheep has just been purchased for $490,000
description: A sheep sold for a record 350,000 guineas -- or around $490,000 in American money -- at an auction in Scotland this week.

title: Greek lawyer labels Manchester United star's kidnap claims as 'fiction'
description: The Greek prosecution lawyer at the center of the Harry Maguire case has questioned the Manchester United football star's version of events after he was found guilty of aggravated assault, resisting arrest and attempted bribery of police following a confrontation with the authorities on the island of Mykonos.

title: French uproar over magazine's portrayal of Black politician as slave
description: A French right-wing magazine has sparked outrage over an illustration published in its most recent issue depicting the Black politician Danièle Obono as an 18th century slave.

title: Former officer in George Floyd killing asks judge to dismiss case
description: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin has asked a judge to dismiss murder charges against him in the death of George Floyd.

title: A husband and wife in Ecuador are the world's oldest married couple
description: Julio Ceasar Mora and his wife Waldramina Maclovia Quinteros have been married for 79 years, and their relationship isn't the only thing with longevity.

title: Norway's Alexander Kristoff recovers from crash to win chaotic first stage of Tour de France
description: Norway's Alexander Kristoff won a crash-filled opening stage of the 2020 Tour de France after a sprint finish in treacherous conditions on Nice's Promenade des Anglais on Saturday, claiming the yellow jersey for the first time in his career.

title: This couple has the best office view in the world
description: Margrit and Joe Fahan were Delta Airline pilots for 30 years.  They documented their farewell water salute at JFK, rescue pet flights  and other up-in-the-air moments for their 15,000 (and counting) Instagram followers

title: Hurricane Laura was so strong it pushed the Mississippi River backwards
description: Strong winds from Hurricane Laura caused surface water on the Mississippi River to change direction.

title: Video shows forceful arrest of Black man stopped while jogging in San Antonio
description: A Black man in San Antonio was stopped and detained by police Tuesday while he was jogging, witnesses said, as officers searched for a suspect in a nearby domestic violence call.

title: Video shows forceful arrest of Black man stopped while jogging
description: A Black man in San Antonio, Texas, was stopped and detained by police while he was jogging, witnesses said, as officers searched for a suspect in a nearby domestic violence call. CNN affiliate KSAT reports.

title: 2 Russian aircraft make 'unsafe' intercept of US Air Force B-52 bomber
description: Two Russian aircraft made an "unsafe, unprofessional" intercept of a US Air Force B-52 bomber on Friday over the Black Sea and in international waters, according to a statement from US Air Forces in Europe and Air Forces Africa Public Affairs.

title: Berlin police halt march protesting against German government's coronavirus response
description: Berlin police ordered a halt to a demonstration Saturday protesting the German government's Covid-19 response, citing the crowd's failure to abide by social distancing guidelines.

title: Belarus revokes accreditation for 15 journalists working for foreign media
description: Fifteen Belarusian journalists have had their accreditation to work for the BBC and other foreign media outlets removed by the authorities, the Belarusian Association of Journalists (BAJ) has said.

title: In Brazil's Javari Valley, isolated communities fear Covid-19 'catastrophe'
description: Remote indigenous communities in Brazil, who have little or no contact with the outside world, are facing a grave threat from Covid-19 -- and advocates accuse the government of failing to protect these vulnerable groups.

title: Friends pay tribute to 'Black Panther' star Chadwick Boseman
This endangered penguin loves to watch a show about penguins
description: It can be a little lonely when you're the only endangered rockhopper penguin being cared for at a zoo in all of  Australasia.

title: Trump's message discipline vanishes
description: President Donald Trump and his rival Joe Biden presented two alternate realities of the state of America at their conventions over the past two weeks -- and the President's ability to persuade wavering moderates and independents will hinge on his ability to stay on message.

title: As Laura heads east, hundreds of thousands are left behind with no power ahead of hot weekend
description: In one coastal Louisiana community, the power may be out for months after Hurricane Laura lashed the state with violent winds and heavy rain earlier this week.

title: 'Say it Loud' documentary details harsh reality of Black MLS soccer players
description: Major League Soccer, as with a large number of other sports leagues in the United States and across the world, is back in full swing. And like other athletes, the Black Players for Change in MLS (BPC) are looking for a way that they can lend their support to the fight against systemic racism -- beyond statements of support, and images of solidarity.

title: Trump's message discipline vanishes a day after convention
What do polls show about civil unrest impact on 2020?
description: As the support for protests and #BLM has waned, Biden's leads in Wisconsin and Minnesota have shrunk. Harry Enten says Trump 'wants the election to be about crime'

title: 'They spied on my campaign': How Trump transformed a conspiracy theory into a political rallying cry
description: President Donald Trump says all the time, "they spied on my campaign." He ad-libbed during his Thursday night convention speech to add the phrase into his prepared remarks. And he tweeted it last week as a rebuttal to former President Barack Obama's convention address.

title: These retailers filed for bankruptcy in August. Here's who might be next
description: The breakneck pace of retail bankruptcies slowed in August, with at least three well-known companies filing for Chapter 11.

title: Why Democrats are worried about Kenosha
description: Former Vice President Joe Biden and President Donald Trump and President Donald Trump both recognize the potential political fallouts if protests in the wake of the Jacob Blake shooting are seen as peaceful or as violent. Biden benefits if they are seen as the former, while Trump is helped if they are seen as the latter.

title: Coronavirus outbreaks identified at 4 sororities at Kansas State University
description: Coronavirus outbreaks have been identified at four sororities at Kansas State University.

title: The crazy-but-true story of a WWII fighter pilot who said his artificial legs saved his life
description: This could be one of the most bizarre "Jeopardy!" clues ever:

title: Bernie Sanders promised to go all in for Biden. Here's what that looks like
description: Bernie Sanders loves the campaign trail. He wants to be "running around the country" hosting rallies, organizing canvasses and leading marches to the polls.

title: A man built a backyard squirrel bar with seven varieties of nuts on tap
description: People are going nuts for an Ohio woodworker's latest creation: A bar that caters to neighborhood squirrels.

title: Born out of racial tensions, Notting Hill Carnival has a rich history. What can we expect this year?
description: Vibrant parades, feathered dancers, infectious live music, and the aroma of delectable Afro-Caribbean cuisine -- these are the things many people look forward to when they descend on the streets of west London during the UK's August holiday weekend.

title: New audio of Trump's sister: Donald has no principles
description: Maryanne Trump Barry, President Donald Trump's sister, is heard on secret audio recordings made by his niece, Mary Trump, describing the president as having "no principles" and only caring about his political base.

title: Trump launches baseless attack on Kamala Harris
description:
• Analysis: Trump's answer on what he would do in a second term was unintelligible
• Biden hits Trump where it hurts: in TV ratings
• Watch: See what happened when Trump crowd was asked to wear masks

title: India struggles to contain its growing Covid-19 cases
description: The number of new coronavirus cases in India continues to skyrocket. CNN's Michael Holmes reports even though states are ramping up testing, getting the epidemic under control is easier said than done.

title: Planet-friendly activities that are good for your body and pandemic possible
description: What's the perfect pandemic hobby? As people across the globe have adjusted their lives to Covid-19, activities as varied as bread baking and gaming have trended.

title: Kanye West's strange presidential bid unravels thanks to messy ballot operation
description: Kanye West is on the ballot in Minnesota and Tennessee but just missed the filing deadline in Wisconsin. Missouri said his petition lacked more than 3,400 valid signatures, but he's gone to court in a last-ditch attempt to get on the ballot in the swing state of Ohio.

title: What China's 'carrier killer' missile tests say about its military capabilities
description: China launched a series of ballistic missiles into the South China Sea this week, according to United States defense officials, part of a flurry of military exercises extending thousands of miles along the country's coastline, as tensions with Washington over the disputed waterway continue to escalate.

title: Stelter: This is going to get under Trump's skin
description: President Trump's convention speech making the case for his reelection was lower-rated than his challenger Joe Biden's speech one week before, according to overnight Nielsen ratings. CNN's Brian Stelter explains.

title: Europe's Covid-19 front line shifts as infections spike
description: At first, the front line of Europe's fight against the Covid-19 pandemic was fought in hospitals by overstretched health care workers. Now as European countries seek to avoid the long-dreaded second wave, that line has shifted to the streets and is being manned by police forces.

title: Kushner heads to Middle East looking to deliver some semblance of a peace deal
description: White House senior adviser Jared Kushner is traveling to the Middle East this weekend to try to convince multiple Arab leaders to attend a splashy signing ceremony at the White House for the recent normalization deal between the United Arab Emirates and Israel.

title: Beijing wants to control what people eat. Experts fear it's a step too far
description: A call from Beijing to reduce food waste has sent officials and businesses scrambling to find ways to stop people from ordering too much, and in some extreme cases put meal times under surveillance.
